0.Title: The Coveted Starting Player
0.Description: Can be bought for 1 of any of: Stone, Clay, Silk, Boar, Glass, Gold, Cattle, Carrot, Food.
0.Snark: Because just going around in a circle is not strategic enough.

1.Title: The Building Building Building
1.Snark: Really, it's just a coincidence that we happen to also be housed in a building. In fact, we built our own building. We did not need a building building building building building.

72.Title: The Obligatory Trader

72.Snark: I'm sure I'll use this enough to justify its purchase.

73.Title: The Military Building
73.Description: Highest Military may trash any 1 Resource for any 1 other Resource, once per turn. In a tie, nobody gets the bonus.
73.Snark: And how do we feel about going military right about now?

74.Title: The Cattle Engine
74.Description: You may trash 1 Cattle for 2 Food, and/or 1 Cattle for any Resource.
74.Snark: Don't base your entire strategy on this card.

89.Snark: I'm pretty sure this strategy worked for me at least once.

90.Title: The Arms Race

91.Title: The Military Commitment
91.Description: Highest Military may trash any 1 Resource for any 1 other Resource, once per turn. In a tie, nobody gets the bonus.

92.Title: The Unfair Deck Dive
92.Description: Upon playing, you may retrieve any card in the discard piles and play it immediately without prerequisites.
92.Snark: Playing this has the hidden advantage of making your opponents hate you.

93.Title: The One-and-Done Card
93.Description: You may trash this card for any 2 Resources.
93.Snark: Make it count. No pressure. Are you sure you that's a good enough use for this card?? There's probably a better move.

94.Title: The Payoff Payoff
94.Description: 3 VPs for each Payoff you have placed.
94.Snark: This card is as close at this game gets to Victory Point Points.

95.Title: The Expensive Payoff
95.Snark: Glad you didn't have to eat these!

96.Title: The Unexpected Payoff
96.Snark: This card favors those who have this deck memorized.

97.Title: The Diversified Strategy Payoff
97.Description: 5 VP for each type: Sheep, Wild Boar, Cattle, Glass, Silk, Grain, Carrot.
97.Snark: This is to make you feel better about having unused stuff.

98.Title: The Investment Payoff
98.Description: 8VP if you have Invested plus 3VP for each Gold.
98.Snark: See! I told you that card would pay off.

99.Title: The Unused Resources Payoff
99.Description: 3 VP for each Wood, Sheep, or Grain
99.Snark: Hey, at least you know nobody else is going for it.

100.Title: The Payoff With Math
100.Description: At game end, take the number of Glass and Silk you have. Square that for VPs.
100.Snark: Go ahead and take your next turn, this is gonna take me a moment.

101.Title: The Military Payoff
101.Description: 3 VP for each Military, +3 additional VP if you end the game with the most military (ties don't count).

102.Title: The Building Payoff Building
102.Description: 1 VP for each Building you've played
102.Snark: You had to see this one coming.

103.Title: Initiate Endgame!
103.Description: When this card is revealed, all Blockers must be paid by the end of the turn. Initiate Endgame.
